body:
was about to file an new issue when i came across this one - it confirms my observations.
i'm getting significant number of:
`Received error: Put https://content-na.drive.amazonaws.com/cdproxy/nodes/0x4Po_W4Q42SeObg0iH6XQ/content: net/http: timeout awaiting response headers - low level retry 4/10`

found in the source code that in such cases the file is deleted from destination. if, instead the code compared the checksum of destination file, or simply not delete the file but returned a transfer error (subject to `--retries` parameter) that would prevent the file being re-uploaded several times.

don't know your codebase enough (or go for that matter) to send a pr - will be on the lookout for the fix. thanks in advance.

UPDATE: rclone 1.30

This is not just a matter of efficiency. With the Amazon Drive quality of service and my internet connection quality, it is practically impossible to up load a large file.

It seems like after each low level retry the transfer is re-initiated. When trying to upload a 4.5Gb file,  the transfer was repeatedly reset to "0% done" with a similar message:

```
2016/08/05 23:26:34 pacer: Rate limited, sleeping for 235.010051ms (1 consecutive low level retries)
2016/08/05 23:26:34 pacer: low level retry 1/1 (error HTTP code 400: "400 Bad Request", reponse body: {"message":"Cannot complete upload"}
)
2016/08/05 23:26:34 XXXXXX.zip: Received error: HTTP code 400: "400 Bad Request", reponse body: {"message":"Cannot complete upload"}
 - low level retry 4/10
2016/08/05 23:26:42 Amazon_Drive: Saving new token in config file
2016/08/05 23:26:44 pacer: Resetting sleep to minimum 20ms on success
```

`rclone: Version "v1.32"`

I have posted a potential fix for the Amazon problem to #606.  I forgot about this ticket when I was doing it though.

What I could do instead is implement this ticket and make sure 400 errors, 504 GATEWAY_TIMEOUT and 408 GATEWAY TIMEOUT return errors that shouldn't be retried from amazon cloud drive.

The one possible downside is the eventual consistency of amazon directory listings - when you upload something it doesn't always appear in the directory listing for a while (seconds usually), so if you uploaded a file, got this sort of error, then immediately restarted the sync then it would upload it again and get a different error at the end.

The fix I posted in #606 only deals with the TIMEOUT errors and not "400 Bad request", so probably what is required is a combination of these two fixes.

issue.title: Uploads to Amazon Cloud Drive restarting at 99%

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Using rclone 1.32 on Windows Server 2012 R2
Connecting to Amazon Cloud Drive
Command used:`rclone sync I:\MOVIES ACD:SERVERNAME\MOVIES --bwlimit 24M --max-size=50G --transfers=6 --exclude ".*/"`

For the past ten days to two weeks, many of my uploads to Amazon hit 99% and then restart at 0%. When I run the command with the verbose command, I regularly see one of the following error messages (in order of frequency):

`error Post https://content-na.drive.amazonaws.com/cdproxy/nodes?suppress=deduplication: write tcp 192.168.2.99:52277->xx.xxx.xxx.xxx:443: wsasend: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host`

`Received error: HTTP code 504: "504 GATEWAY_TIMEOUT", no response body` `- low level retry`
(these low level retries sometimes get up to four or five before finally succeeding)

`Received error: HTTP code 500: "500 Internal Server Error", reponse body: {"message":"Internal failure"}
`

Is there something happening on Amazon's end? I upped the transfer number to six in the hopes that more attempts would lead to more successful uploads and it seems to be working, but I am still seeing regular resets.

body:
I suppose the directory listing delay issue can impact many scenarios, not only when the upload was interrupted and resumed. If so, I think the benefits of using a partially-loaded file are greater than the potential issues.

Please also check if the following error really requires the removal of the remote failed copy

```
2016/08/06 23:51:47 pacer: Rate limited, sleeping for 947.77941ms (1 consecutive low level retries)
2016/08/06 23:51:47 pacer: low level retry 1/1 (error Post https://content-na.drive.amazonaws.com/cdproxy/nodes?suppress=deduplication: write tcp 192.168.1.14:58880->52.72.69.9:443: wsasend: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host.)
2016/08/06 23:51:47 XXXXXX.zip: Received error: Post https://content-na.drive.amazonaws.com/cdproxy/nodes?suppress=deduplication: write tcp 192.168.1.14:58880->52.72.69.9:443: wsasend: An existing connection was forcibly closed by the remote host. - low level retry 1/10
```

That error is a really useful one to retry - gets used a lot in drive uploads. 

The proper solution would be for amazon to implement a chunked upload like all the other providers! 

Maybe the best solution in the meantime would be for rclone to detect if it had sent the last byte of the file or not. If it hadn't then the file definitely isn't complete. If it had then it could check for it (several times if necessary).  I  could probably implement this at a high level... Will think further.

For what it's worth, I reverted to v1.29 (from v1.30) and it takes care of the issue. The uploads error out but the higher-level retries see files already uploaded. (v1.29 does not delete the file on error).

I've taken the latest built http://pub.rclone.org/v1.32-18-g29ab7ea%CE%B2/ published as part of #606, but it seems like the upload is still restarted from zero after a "504 GATEWAY_TIMEOUT" error.
See the [relevant section](http://pastebin.com/raw/QxsMSgbA) of the log file.

issue.title: ACD: Continuous "Failed to copy: HTTP cod 504: "504 GATEWAY_TIMEOUT", no response body" error

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
rclone version: v1.32
OS: Ubuntu Server 16.04.1
Storage: Amazon Cloud Drive
Command: `rclone sync -v --stats=10s --low-level-retries=1 --log-file=<file_path> --transfers=3 /tmp/.PlexMedia MediaServerBackup:/PMS/`
[Log File](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/404149/rclone_log_20160804.txt)

I've been doing an initial seeding of my home server and upload has been really good for the most part. I've been able to upload about 7.5 TB in the last week and have not had many errors (perhaps 3% of files uploading would fail). 

However, I've killed rclone syncs at various times over the last week for various reasons. However, now it appears all the files (they're starting to be the larger files as well) are beginning to not only transfer, but also receive the 504 error. Every now and again one of the files transfers without error, but I nearly will have a 1 to 1 match of files transferred to errors. All the errors are the `504 GATEWAY_TIMEOUT` errors.

Is there something that is causing this or that I can do to avert this? Thanks

body:
@ncw No, the [relevant section](http://pastebin.com/raw/QxsMSgbA) of the log file says that the file was only 17% done when a 504 happened.

Perhaps the recovery delay should be closer to the IO idle timeout (default 5m0s).

@zstadler if not all the file got sent then the work-arounds won't be effective - a retry is the only option.

Do you have the whole log file I could look at - I't like to see whether the token refreshing worked or not?

Apparently, I have misunderstood this issue, thinking a **failed copy** it is likely to be a **partial** copy, and that keeping it will allow rclone to resume the upload to Amazon Drive. 

@ncw The token refreshing seems to work fine. For example:

```
2016/08/09 08:19:21 amazon drive root 'XXX': Token expired - 4 uploads in progress - refreshing
2016/08/09 08:19:23 Amazon_Drive: Saving new token in config file
2016/08/09 08:19:24 amazon drive root 'XXX': Token refresh successful
```

Unfortunately you can't resume an upload with ACD - the API isn't rich enough :-(

Thanks for the token refreshing log.  I'm hoping that will make a difference.

By the way, were you able to get an invitation to the "[invite-only updated RESTful API](https://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:B7w7LdHc_zEJ:https://developer.amazon.com/public/apis/experience/cloud-drive/+&cd=1&hl=iw&ct=clnk&gl=il&client=firefox-b-ab)"?
My request was denied...
